original_title: Jorge Grau: Catalonia's Cult Film King
overview: This is the first and only feature-length documentary on the life and cinema of the late Jorge Grau, who is most famous for his classic social-political horror masterpiece "Living Dead at Manchester Morgue" (1974), seen by some critics as a fierce critique of the Franco government albeit set in a displaced foreign locale.
title: Jorge Grau: Catalonia's Cult Film King
